alert.note: Alert for Hidalgo (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 18 at 12:27PM MDT until March 19 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Gila River Above Virden affecting Hidalgo County. .Runoff from recent rains and snowmelt will lead to minor flooding along portions of the Gila River near Virden. For the Gila River...including Gila, Virden, Redrock...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Gila River Above Virden. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Saturday, March 18 the stage was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to between 9.0 to 10.0 feet by Monday afternoon. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Gila River Virden 15.0 12.4 Sat 11 am MD 11.1 9.8 9.4 &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 1200 PM MDT.
